body.name: Wyze Wireless Video Doorbell Pro (Chime Included), 1440 HD Video, 1:1 Aspect Ratio: 1:1 Head-to-Toe View, 2-Way Audio, Night Vision
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 6 hrs 58 mins
features: Wire-Free. Screw-Free. Hassle-Free: Effortlessly mount Wyze Wireless Doorbell Pro for front porch protection in under 30 seconds. Screws and hardwiring equipment, though optional, are included, for even more ways to install.
See the whole story - clearly: A 1440x1440 fuller than HD sensor means you'll see it all with 33% more clarity than traditional HD cameras.
Chime Included: Hear your doorbell ring, chirp, or bark. Choose between 20 unique tunes and 8 sound levels to find the perfect chime for you, even scare off potential intruders with a dog bark.
Optional upgrade available: upgrade to Cam Plus to receive real-time alerts when people are detected and store full-length videos in the cloud for 14-days.
body.description: Built for ease of use and installation, Wyze Video Doorbell Pro gives you everything you want without everything you don’t. If you don’t like screws, no problem, a 3M adhesive strip is included, just peel and stick to any frame. Hate wiring? Us too! That’s why we put a massive battery in there that lasts up to 6 months. Never miss anything with an ultrawide, head-to-toe viewing angle of your front porch in fuller-than-HD resolution. Unlike some companies, Wyze doesn’t charge you a subscription fee just to use basic features of your doorbell. What we do offer is Cam Plus that unlocks awesome extra features like Package Detection, Person Detection, and unlimited video cloud storage. See more than ever before, wire free, with Wyze Video Doorbell Pro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SUPER HAPPY, GREAT
reviews.reviewText: THIS IS THE THIRD ONE I HAVE. GREAT PRODUCT. EASY TO SET UP. INSTRUCTIONS EASY TO UNDERSTAND. WORKS AMAZING, SHARP IMAGES. TO GET THE BEST OUT OF IT WILL REQUIRE A SUBSCRIPTION, BUT EVEN WITHOUT IT, IT WORK AMAZING

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing doorbell camera with no wiring needed
reviews.reviewText: This doorbell camera is very nice. It has great picture quality. It does not need to be wired in which was the selling point for me. A user-friendly installation process is important, especially for those who may not be tech-savvy. The app has a step by step guide for installing it and allows for customization based on what you want. The chime for the inside of your house has a lot of different sound options!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent addition to our home security
reviews.reviewText: I have had Wyze cameras for about a year, mostly outdoor, including one at our front door. The camera is great, but I have it mounted low on a planter so sometimes it's not the most conducive for seeing who is at the door. When our doorbell recently starting ringing on its own, we decided to get the Wyze wireless doorbell. I didn't realize what we were missing! It's a great product and works very well within my camera system. I am not at all handy, but I was easily able to remove our old doorbell and hook this one up using the existing wires. The chime feature plugs into an outlet and works well, plus it's customizable with several different chimes. The picture is excellent and works well at night, and the motion detection is great. I have been able to communicate with deliveries when I am not at home through the new doorbell. Definitely recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the basics
reviews.reviewText: I currently have the Waze door bell pro, and it works well, it connects with no real issues, at times the app freeze. This door bell record seconds be and after. I think Waze pro door bell worth it for budget friendly options. Also has good fish eye lens to see all around. It is a easy installation.Pros:Affordable, good lens, decent microphone. Free to use, but limited.Cons:Plastic mounting kit, no SD, laggy notifications, don't get full length records unless subscribe, blue ring light always one. Imagine quality is okay. Needs WiFi to work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have a number of Wyze cameras and chose this because I want to stay within the same ecosystem. I pay for the yearly alerting so I can't tell if/how this changes the functionality but it works great. If someone comes close to my door my phone notifies me. If the doorbell rings the plug-in doorbell module is nice and loud (the volume and chime are adjustable). The battery holds a charge for several months - if you look at it constantly after installing it you will get the impression that the battery dies quickly but if you only use it for occasionally monitoring and for alerts it's great. Very pleased with as well as the Wyze cameras - very good value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great battery life and good picture with this doorbell.
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this product for 6 months now. i love that the product is wireless and does not require mounting screws. I live in a apartment and did not want to have to screw the mount to the property. The camera good be a bit better bit it is not bad. The ai motion detection is great and i have had no false alrams. I like the ability to set up a detection zone. it detects both people and packages well. I initially charged the battery and just today jan 7 decided to recharge the battery. it was still at 48% even after 6 months of use. night vision would be an improvement but the camera does well in low light. I am very happy with this purchase and have recommended it to others already.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Absolute garbage. Drops connection frequently, misleading claims of battery life.
reviews.reviewText: I've actually gone through two units because I was sure the first one was defective. Nope.Claims to work on both 2.4g and 5g WiFi frequencies. The problems I have experienced on the 2.4g frequency are more than doubled on the 5g frequency. It also seems to not like other devices such as phones and tablets on the same frequency. Turning airplane mode on my phone on and off would cause it to malfunction.Doorbell, chime box, and router need to be within 30 feet of each other for best results. Mine are about 6 feet from each other and all of these issues are persistent. I've even tested having all three in the same room with the same results. Several times a week (sometimes daily) the system will drop connection, stop recording and uploading, stop sending notifications, and will not reconnect unless I restart the chime box or the router. The doorbell WILL work on the chime box regardless, so that connection doesn't seem to be the problem, but several times a week it turns into just an overpriced remote doorbell with no other functionality.When it DOES work, it doesn't work great. I've quadruple checked all my settings and have tested different detection settings, detection zones, detection sensitivity and the results are not very different. In various combinations of settings, this thing will record and upload people walking across the street, but will occasionally ignore the mailman, and ignore even me entering and leaving. So who knows what else it doesn't upload.6 month battery life? LOL!!! 3 weeks, max.Again, I've gone thru 2 units with the same results. I've even gone so far as to have the cable company swap my router, thankfully that didn't cost me anything. By the way, you can't switch the network on these things without deleting them from your profile and reconfiguring as a new camera. To top it all off, the doorbell itself also emits a chime when pressed, rather loud, and there's no way to shut that off.The Wyze OG cam I have in the backyard works perfectly, though. I'll probably just install another in the front and have a normal doorbell.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great doorbell cam
reviews.reviewText: Easy install and setup with reliable and easy app to view anytime anywhere.

Me encanta el Wyze Doorbell Pro porque el timbre es Bluetooth y no necesita conectarse a través del enrutador. Si la red eléctrica se corta, tiene una batería de respaldo y restablece inmediatamente la conexión a Internet cuando vuelve la energía. El timbre normal (diseño antiguo) no hacía estas cosas.

No puedo creer la duración de la pila, lo compramos hace 4 meses y apenas lleva la mitad de la pila. Cumple correctamente con lo que necesitamos sin necesidad de contratar el servicio mensual. Excelente compra!

reviews.reviewTitle: (No) Es un excelente producto, tiene muchos problemas.
reviews.reviewText: Actualizacion: noviembre del 2023El producto a veces manda las llamadas VoIP tarde, las he recibidos muchos minutos después de que timbraron.El timbre exterior (el botón que presionan las visitas) también hace sonido al tocar, por lo que todos los vecinos que estén cerca saben que alguien te visita.Mi timbre quedó apuntando a un área donde tocan y detrás está lleno de plantas y arbustos, y al moverse las plantas el timbre constantemente alerta de movimiento... como que deberían tener la IA configurada para distinguir arboles y sombras, en mi opinión.Casi todos esos líos los tienen otros timbres... yo confío en los productos Wyze pero tendré que esperar a una nueva versión del hardware para quedar satisfecho.------------ACTUALIZADO OTRA VEZ:Con todo y las soluciones extremas que hice, como ponerle un timer para que se reinicie constantemente, da MUCHISIMOS problemas de conexion. es mas rapido bajar las escaleras y salir a ver quien toca que abrir la camara del timbre en tu celular. Para cuando carga, ya se fueron las personas. Y eso si carga. Reiniciarlo cada ahora no ayuda en todos los casos. A veces de nada sirve. Si no lo estas reiniciando, deja de funcionar en menos de una hora. No lo recomiendo. Las camaras estan bien, el timbre no.Setup: El timbre esta en una columna de concreto justo en la salida de la casa, esta conectado con un adaptador de corriente a la luz siempre. El modem esta a maximo 4 metros del timbre. La campana la tenia a 5 metros del router pero la he tenido que mover a 2 metros del timbre. DOS METROS. Es casi igual que poner una campana con una cuerda en el sentido de escuchar cuando timbran. La otra opción es activar las llamadas IP cuando timbran para que suene el telefono y te delate que estas en casa cuando no quieres abrir.En resumen, no me ha gustado este producto de Wyze.------------La cámara del timbre parece escribir a una memoria interna los eventos, asi como en la nube, por algún motivo parece que no elimina los videos viejos de la memoria interna y llega un momento que ya no puede escribir a la memoria interna y se queda congelada, pausada, sin enviar notificaciones... eso ya lo había dicho en la previa actualización...La novedad es que al reiniciar el timbre (la campana) se libera la memoria de la cámara/timbre exterior... entonces, conecté "la campana" del doorbell pro a un timer de Steren economico y lo programo el timer para que cada hora apague por 1 minuto la campana o timbre interior, y la vuelva a encender.Así ya no tengo NINGUN problema. Supongo este tema lo arreglarán con una actualización porque claramente es un tema de software, que se arregla al reiniciar la campana del timbre._________ACTUALIZADO:Muchos problemas de conexión incluso estando cerca el router, el timbre y la campana.______Review original:Lo configuré para recibir llamadas cada que presionen el timbre, y puedo ver el video porque es llamada de VoIP que además tienes la app por si no quieres recibir llamadas, solo notificaciones.Además, obviamente, deje la "campana" dentro de la casa, por lo que siempre que lo presionan suena en la casa.Además le compré un adaptador de corriente en Amazon, para no tener que ponerlo donde tenía el timbre original la casa... entonces con que tengas un enchufe de luz cerca de donde quieres tener tu timbre, queda a tu gusto no como te lo pusieron al hacer la casa. En mi caso, lo mande hasta afuera, ya que lo tenía en la cochera... y en la cochera aún está el timbre original, como una especie de segundo timbre... pero pienso convertir mi anterior timbre en una conexión eléctrica después.En resumen, excelente. No olvides activar CamPlus por 80 pesos al mes o menos, pero te detecta y sabe diferenciar entre personas, mascotas, autos y paquetes. Y te notifica según tus preferencias si detecta cada una de esas cosas, y puedes configurar que grabe video, suene la sirena de tus cámaras wyze, que "ladre" el timbre, etc
Funciona bien pero casi no se escucha el timbre

La calidad del vídeo no es la mejorCómo dicen en otra reseña, hay que reiniciar el "chime" o campana después de un cierto tiempo porque si no, deja de grabar eventos.El registro de eventos es mejor que el del Ring Video Doorbell y el costo de la suscripción de Cam plus es de casi la mitad que del Ring.Por el precio y lo que ofrece, no lo recomendaría. Solo que este en promoción te convendría adquirirlo.
